text: Called in for pick up, the meat combination pho and summer rolls. Rolls are mostly lettuce and bean sprouts. Hardly any meat in my soup, it's ridiculous. They only offer 3 meats in the combination pho so it could be filled more. I'm not one to complain but I feel ripped off. Portion super small for 9$.

The noodle dishes were mostly noodle with very little vegetables or meat.
The meat dishes weren't too bad, like chicken basil, except they were very oily.
My biggest problem with this restaurant was the overall cleanliness of the place (poor).  It really felt almost dangerous to eat there.  Fortunately, fried or stir-fried food is pretty safe in almost any locale, so none of us got sick or anything.
There are many better Thai and Vietnamese places to choose from around Las Vegas, so I don't recommend this one.

Seen an ad at my local gym , 10% off meal with the key . They didn't honor the ad so I had to pay full price. Came here during lunch hour , only a couple tables but took almost 30 minutes for our foods . Foods were mediocre, compared to archis and pan Asian, this place need some works, take it easy on the sugars. 
Probably won't come back again.

The restaurant has been open for only a week when we visited. 

I tried the chicken larb and it tasted different than the larb I've had at other Thai restaurants. It was very crunchy, like there was dried onion (or galangal) mixed in with the chicken. I'm not sure if crunchy larb is another version served by some Thai chefs, but it was unexpected. Nonetheless, the larb didn't have much flavor so the crunchiness might have been the only good thing about it.

We tried the Vietnamese rice dishes and pho. These also did not taste remotely like anything they're supposed to. The pho broth was very sweet (not flavorful, just sugary sweet), and the spices were not familiar. These entrees weren't bad, just not very authentic at all. If you want authentic Vietnamese, you'd be better off eating elsewhere.

Got chicken pad Thai to-go so I could eat something while smoking hookah at Madhouse. All I gotta say it's a super cute place and the pad Thai was good. I think it was made with pho noodles but it's still yummy nonetheless. Mine was a level 7 spicy and the flavors made up for the difference in noodle texture. Would definitely go back to try other dishes.
Great food nice neighborhood atmosphere. Service was good. Nice people. Green curry was sublime.  Yellow was almost as good.

I was surprised that the place was empty at 6 pm. Their food is great, we had pho and pineapple fried rice. Their food is definitely authentic, because it tasted nothing like the pho and fried rice I've had at large popular restaurants in town. And their prices are reasonable. Absolutely recommended!!
great little place close to home just found our go to Thai place. great flavor, great service.
I love this quiet place. I like the husband's cooking more than the wife's. For dessert, try the fried bananas. They have good wifi too. If you want peace and quiet with good food, come here.

Our family 10 peoples come to this restaurant on 28 dec , before we came we called made reservation , a men worked at front deck set up table for us very nice . Food excellent , service the best , cook fast .

Food was very good, we tried the papaya salad, seafood tom yum and pad thai. Service on the other hand was lacking, kids too busy on Facebook to give us service. Had to shake our empty glasses of water for a bit till they got the hint. Waited ten min watching them play on computer before going up and asking for our check so we could leave.

i love Thai food and always search for a good place. this place is it. the food is decently priced like any other restaurant maybe even a few bucks cheaper. anyway the quality of the food is great and the quantity is also great they really give you a lot. very quiet, chill, environment. for sure coming back. Thai tea and coffee here are also great.
The food at this place is not worth your money. They have small portions and the flavor is gross.
Great food! Got pad see ew and the portion was so generous. Friends got panang curry and tom yum soup and loved the powerful flavor of their dishes. Would come again.
Very good mom and pop place w/fresh ingredients and good dishes. My favorite comfort food is beef pho and they execute it pretty well. Haven't tried any other dishes yet but probably will soon.

The pad see was very good, had good flavor as for spicy I went with a two because he said they were true to the number, very good advice. I liked the spring roll it too had good flavor to it. Next time I will try the curry and fried rice, I love they use "NO MSG" and have it posted. I went at 2:40 so I got the lunch special portion  it was plenty enough and had left overs. I do recommend you give it a try it's very affordable and you can go during the lunch time specials, or spend a couple extra dollars and get the full portion and have the full menu option. Great customer service, very friendly, clean establishment.

This review is a comparison of the pho I had from the other two nearby places. Had the pho hai san. First off, you get a lot for what you pay for. The basil wasn't as fresh as I've had but I will write it off as an off day and will report next time on this when I go back. The variety of pho is the most out of the three restaurants except for maybe the other place where you can custom make your pho. The broth was mild in flavor but I wonder if it's because I got the seafood instead of a meat selection. My pho did come with thinly sliced onions which added to the flavor. The dining area is small but clean and is my second favorite regarding decor. 

I would definitely come back because this place has the best bang for the buck.
Food is always excellent, particularly their noodle based dishes. Food is usually ready very promptly. Guy behind the counter is always courteous, friendly, and ready to assist.

We were looking for somewhere to eat on Thanksgiving and happened upon this place. What a gem!  The food was delicious; the staff was friendly: the portions are large, and the prices are reasonable.  We will definitely eat here again!
This has to be the best pad Thai and coconut curry and pot stickers I have had in Las Vegas and I have been to A lot of places here

My daughter and I wanted to try someplace new and stopped into Lilly's tonight. We shared the Summer rolls with Tofu, Potstickers, Chicken Pad Thai and Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio which was grilled pork and Vietnamese Egg rolls over vermicelli and fresh veggies. It was all delicious and extremely fresh, especially the veggies. Little things stood out like how awesome the sauce for the Potstickers was. 

The atmosphere is clean but basic, it's all about the food and the service. Our waiter was friendly, knowledgeable and took the time to answer all of our questions. 

We will be back!
Went there on accident. But it was a great restaurant. Got the spice level right, good portion. Excellent service.

Good food good prices great portion sizes.  I don't have much more to say, yelp got mad at me for filling in the rest of my review with II's.
So here it is, good food, good service, good portion size, good value.
Delicious, flavourful and really spicy Curry! Service us quick and great. Will return.

Yelp continues to disappoint in Vegas. I tried the Thai Fried Rice and Pho Chin Nam. The pho was skimpy on the meat, but it tasted OK but not great. The rice wasn't actually Thai Fried Rice and was rather bland. I always order Thai Fried Rice at Thai restaurants because this style is my favorite. So when the dish came out with no tomatoes, it was a surprise, especially since the menu describes it with tomatoes (as is standard). Instead, it contains carrots, corn, and green beans. WTF is this? When I asked why the difference from what the menu describes, I was told that they removed the tomatoes "a long time ago" because customers didn't like it "so fishy" ... uh, what? When have tomatoes ever been fishy? And green beans? Corn? This is definitely not Thai Fried Rice, and relying on Yelp in Vegas continues to make me shake my head.
So great food! I love the price! Fast delivery service and friendly staff! If you craving some thai food i truly recommend here
Food is great and staff is very friendly! I got pad Thai with chicken and it was delicious. I would definitely recommend this place to others and will be going back myself!

I had tried a few Thai places in my hood and they were all pretty much forgettable, so I kind of gave up on it for almost a year. I live less than 5 minutes from Lilly's and decided to give it a shot when a random jones for Pho Ga hit one night. I've eaten at some A-list Vietnamese places in San Fran and the East Bay area when I go to visit family there, places so legit you won't hear a word of English when you go there. Lilly's wasn't far off the mark - delish white meat chicken with bean sprouts and noodles, not too salty. The pot stickers and spring rolls were good, but the summer rolls were a level up on the intensity. Massive portion, hint of cilantro, perfect with peanut sauce. The bun ga nuong cha gio was excellent, something new for me, tasty and unique. Large thai ice tea that was better than most, the thai spice was spot on, sweet but not over the top like some can be. It was pretty quiet when I stopped by later at night, there was only one person eating in. The kid at the counter was friendly and we chatted for a minute. I'm looking forward to trying the Thai food to see if it measures up also. Very solid as far as Vegas goes, I will definitely be keeping this place in my back pocket. It was tough to find for a second as there are a couple rows of strip malls packed in behind Vons and the new Anytime Fitness that just opened. Lilly's is 2 doors down from Madhouse Coffee on one side and next to a dry cleaner's on the other. Definitely worth a look.
Everything was delicious. I love Thai food and decided to give this place a chance. Curry chicken is on point, so are the fried calamari, fried rice and shrimp. Love it.
such good food. never had spicy pad thai that was still so flavorful. had no idea how i've missed this place when ever i'm around that area. it's a must go.
Always great food. Pho ve don is my favorite. Nice delivery guy Its been a rough week and good food heals the soul!

I have seen this place long time cause I used to go mad house coffee but I haven't try this place yet. So I decided to try lily's thai for today. And I love this place!!
I ordered pad thai and my spicy level was 10 of 10. 
This place's pad thai is one of the bestest pad thai that  I ever had. I will definitely coming back! Thank you for serving delicious foods!

We ordered the tofu pad Thai and the combo pho and they were both delicious!!  The tofu was cooked perfectly and the pad Thai had perfect texture and taste. The pho soup had great flavor with the basil and jalapeños. We will definitely be back!

I have only eaten here once so my review is more on the customer service than it is on the food. I ordered a Thai salad #3 spicy out of 10. I get that these run a little spicier so I try to get a low number. When I got my food it was burning my lips it was so hot! It was literally a 10 out of 10. I took it back to let the guy know that I ordered a 3 and it was really hot. He rolled his eyes and he said he will tell them to remake it. So I came back in 10 minutes and I swear to you it was still as spicy and I don't feel like it was changed at all. I did not take it back at that point because I didn't want to deal with the guy at the front.

FYI... I did a delivery order. 

I ordered:

Pho Tai: broth was okay but wtf happened to the noodles? When I poured the soup into the noodles they didn't separate. So I started to stir it around and then the noodles starting breaking and it became blocks of noodles. 

Tom yum: I asked for it to be hot and I swear it was less than mild. It wasn't even sour so it tasted like watered down tom yum. Plus I thought it was weird they used cherry tomatoes.

Spring rolls: $6 for two spring rolls and you're only going to put one shrimp split in half in each spring roll? Then stuff the rest with lettuce and noodles? I feel like they just robbed my money after I ate that. 

Thai tea: was just thai tea. Really sweet. 

Total was $28 plus tip.
Customer service, veggie phò, and Thai spring rolls were outstanding!  We'll definitely be back in the near future.  Bonus:  we also receive 7% Yelp Cash.

So always notice Lilly since next to one of my regular coffee spots. Always looking try new places plus was in the mood for Thai lunch special action. 

I ended up getting the Panang Curry with Chicken. Any Panang Curry would say fan of with Thai food. It always going be losing battle when think about lotus of siam the ultimate Panang Curry sauce. Lilly is pretty solid in my opinion. It had a nice depth in flavor, love love the color, and compliments the chicken and vegetables perfectly. Chicken and Vegetables was cooked on point. The only thing would complain is wish got bigger portion. Truth is lunch special so expect smaller portion. The lunch specials one thing that really stood out compare other Thai restaurants diversity. It takes up whole page on the menu not just couple items but literally filled it out. You got choose from noodle dishes, curries, and regular dishes. The price is steal of deal most of them is under $8. It comes with your standard egg roll and rice (you can do brown rice besides white rice). 

The service was fabulous. I was the only one in the restaurant and went when it first opened. The gentlemen was great. It was my first time explained the menu, friendly, and just great service!!!

Lilly will be spot come back try more of the menu...

This is my go-to spot for Pho. We always dine in. Its small, but always clean and quiet. The staff is so kind and attentive.  We usually start with the chicken pot stickers, which remind me a lot of dumplings. There is so much goddess packed in that little bite. 
Their pho is always proper. Flavorful broth and good sized portion for $6-8. And their thai iced teas are delish. 

Highly recommend this spot.

Solid little Vietnamese place. I stopped here for a quick bite to eat on my way home and needed something to go as I had a meeting to attend. As soon as I walked in, a woman quickly greeted me and I asked if they had any banh mi's. She said, yes, pork, which is exactly what I was craving. Perfect. She said she'd have it right out to go for me and they did. Seriously don't think it took 5 minutes. Got home, unwrapped my sandwich and chowed down. The bread was clearly fresh and had the perfect light crunch on the outside and soft middle like a truly fresh French bread should! The meat was flavorful and texture was perfectly soft. I love love love that they didn't skimp on the cilantro and carrots. Austin, TX needs to step up their banh mi game. Take note!

Decided to try a new place today. The server was really helpful helping me decide on my plate . The food was amazing . It's a perfect mom and pops restaurant . You can taste the original recipes , I can't remember the name of the plate but the pork had so much flavor it was crazy . Definitely going back soon!

This was my first visit to Lily's at this location. I used to go often when it was in Sahara several years ago, but never since the move. We enjoyed our lunch. The nam sod was light and tasty and I enjoyed that it was served on lettuce instead of on rice. The egg rolls were ok, nothing special, but they came with a very tasty sauce that I'd like to try on something else. My wife had pad Thai and she said it was good. I'm looking forward to my next visit.

I would probably have given a better rating but when I went in the person who took my to go order wasn't very nice...I don't remember his name I came in around 8:45 at night but I still expected him to be somewhat nice... I ordered the pho tai and spring rolls and since I just moved back to Vegas I lost my Asian pho soup spoon and asked if I could get one..the guy said no!! I said I'll pay for it I don't mind! He said no!! We don't sell and walked away from me! NEVER in all my times of eating Pho from Nevada to Florida did ANY restaurant not at least sell it to me! He told me I could use the little plastic spoon that come in the bag...smh needless to say this is the last time I will order from here

Ever have 1 great experience and then feel totally ripped off by the 2nd? We apparently got lucky w/ our 1st visit to Lilly's. Food was good & fresh, service was aight. 2nd visit: $15 Wonton soup that was just broth, a couple wontons, cabbage and an odd amount of pre-ground black pepper was the 1st foul. Mixed Seafood Pad Thai featuring old, stanky mussels was the 2nd. The sauce was broken, the noodles that awful texture you get from grocer's pantry just-add-water pad Thai. We sent it back to receive a 10% discount. They served us ratchet food & expected us to pay $4.50/bite of it! We serve for a living, and it takes an awful lot to get us to tip sub-20%, but we left 10% and awkwardly shrugged this sad little joint off. It feels good to support a struggling small business, but it feels extra-shitty to have it repay its guests by daring them to argue over the tab on their F-ups. So that's why Lilly's is always empty. If you like looking for hidden SE Asian gems stick to Spring Mountain.

The food is good quality and tastes great. The service is quick and friendly. The tap water tastes good. The atmosphere is comfortable and quiet. I got pad Thai with chicken at level 4/10 spice. It was delicious. The flavor were distributed evenly amongst the dish giving it a consistently good taste. I would definitely recommend this place to friends and family.

We had the Lilly's house noodle and spicy seafood clay pot. Both dishes were delicious and priced very reasonably. I'd have to return to see how their pad Thai tastes, but I think this is my new go-to Thai restaurant in Las Vegas.

I've always wanted to try Pho and I'm soo glad I did.  I had the chicken pho and it was amazing.  Whatever spices are in that and green peppers give it that heat that sneaks up on you.  The chicken larb is amazing with fresh cilantro and mint - just love it.  Try it!

Loving this place.
Came here with a huge cravings for curry.
Luckily, it was just across the parking lot from where I was.
I ordered their Panang Curry with chicken & tofu. It came just at the right amount of time. The ingredients was fresh & the curry was so delicious with the spice level #4.
I would definitely be back.

Ordered the shrimp pad Thai. It was good enough. Nothing to shout about. The shrimp were perfectly cook just not a lot of flavor. Also had the spring rolls. They were really good. Friendly service when I came to pick up my order. I will be back to try other dishes.

Great new location & they have take-away!
It's a generous portion for the price of a small on the Pho.

It's Tuesday! So that means I'm craving Thai food. Thai food Tuesdays lol. Anyways, I came here for some pork pad see ew because my other go to places were either closed or on vacation. So this place was my third choice. I ordered pad see ew and an iced Thai coffee. The pork pad see ew was pretty good. It had nice flavor and a good kick. I ordered it level 3 spicy. The only thing that I didn't like was their iced Thai coffee. It was just mainly sweet and I didn't really taste much of a coffee flavor. I'd come again if my other go to Thai places are closed.

This place is small was really clean. The service was amazing and the server was quick to order. We ordered summer rolls with shrimp and it is freshly made.  The Pho noodle soup was amazing and the Thai curry was perfect! Its only one mile from our home so we are definitely coming back here.

Wow! This was my first time eating from here and I ordered delivery that should've taken an hour and they were here in 30 minutes. I ordered the Panang Scallops, Thai Salad and Pork Satay (yes, just for me, although the leftovers my husband will eat) and I am pleasantly surprised! I am always willing to try new Thai restaurants in town and this one is near the top. Thumbs up!

My boyfriend and I love this place. I always order the chicken pad Thai (lunch or dinner portion) and both are big enough to fill me for two meals. My boyfriend always gets the beef pho and he says it's amazing, I've only ever tried the broth which is great. Not that I don't want to fully the the pho, it's just I like to save my appetite for the delicious chicken pad Thai. I usually order it at a 5 and boy is it spicy! And I am a spicy food fanatic, so if you're not be aware haha. The food is always fresh and the people who work there are sweet. You can tell it's a mom and pop place and that's why I love it. Prices are reasonable. I'll definitely go back :) (also, try their Thai milk tea it's delicious!)

My boyfriend and I stopped in here for lunch today. Unfortunately we missed the lunch special but the food was delicious. The chicken sate was the best I've ever had. I ordered the shrimp stir fry and he got the pad thai. Both were very flavorful.  We can't wait to come back again.

I just got delivery from here and it's fantastic. Great prices and good quality food. Definitely one of my new favorite places to order from plus the delivery guy was really nice. Only downside is the delivery took about an hour which is typical.
I ordered fried calamari. Most other places I get fried calamari, it comes squishy and gooey. Not Lillies! The calamari was super light and fluffy with a nice crunch. Also the size of the pieces were pretty big and the sauce that came with it was amazing.
I also got the green chicken curry and got it spicy medium. The flavor was great and the vegetables were cooked to perfection. Also the chicken was amazing and juicy. 
My friend got the combination pho. It was kinda mediocre. The flavor of the broth was there but the consistency was thin and it was really oily. The noodles were already kinda hard which is an easy fix but still we had just got it so it should've been like that yet. Also the meat didn't look super fresh and one piece of the flank was a little green. The pho was still good though regardless. 
Overall this place was really great and would definitely go back
I work around the corner, Why did I not find this place sooner!!! My Go To place for pad thai, drunken noodles or pho!! Love it! Food is great, price is reasonable and staff is friendly!
This won't be long. The food and service was great. Nice atmosphere and it's a great value.

The service was attentive and great. The food wasn't at all what I imagined. The food all had a Tom Yum flavoring base which was kinda odd and it made the food fishy smelling and tasting which was awful. Myself, I ordered Drunken Noodle.. I've tried a bunch of drunken noodles before and this was waaaay different. First off the noodle was super overcooked so it was mushy and broken. Typical drunken noodles are somewhat solid not broken into a bunch of pieces looking like baby food. The shrimp fried rice had such a fishy taste to it and it was really greasy. I love Thai food so I've eaten at majority of the places by me, but this experience wasn't something I'd like to come back nor recommend. The only good thing from this place was the pa nang curry which tasted and looked exactly like a yellow coconut curry lol.

I tried their pad thai as soon as they open. I usually like eat spicy number 8 to 10. 
It was not spicy at all and taste nothing.

The staff is not really friendly.

Online orderin system was good.
I ordered a to go pho combination, the container of the soup is broken. And they said that the combination is a lot, is only 5 pieces of meat and no tendons... no good!

Very disappointing :( I really wanted to love this place being that it's so near to us. The service was great, there was one waiter who was friendly & attentive. Food was poor quality. 

Appetizers: Spring roll- I'm not a huge fan of spring rolls to begin with but my bf ordered. I thought the wrap was too thick, I'm big on texture and it felt weird. Wontons were probably the best dish, fried Foods can never go wrong. 

Main course: we both got pho, I had the well done brisket & steak pho which came with about 3 pieces of meat. I ordered more meat on the side which was a $2 up-charge.

Dessert: mango sticky rice is one of my fav desserts, sticky rice was good not the best quality and mangos were about to go bad, very mushy & flavor was almost tart.

Overall, I thought the place was well kept but I will not be returning.

great food great service! it's a very small cute place with great portions of food as well. my friends and i got the drunken noodles, yellow curry, and pad thai noodles with calamari as an appetizer. all super good! definitely gonna be a regular stop for us now since it's right next to our fav coffee place :)

Several years ago, I stopped at Lilly's to get take out but in those days they closed between lunch and dinner.  Having dropped a friend off at home, this was a nearby choice to get some Thai food--something I've been neglecting recently.

The restaurant is a small space in a strip mall in the Von's plaza on DI.  I was told I could sit wherever I wanted, and I was brought water and the Thai iced coffee I ordered for this hot day.

Looking over the menu, I stopped when I came to the duck selections.  It was simply a matter of choosing which one.  I opted for the Ka pao duck which is boneless, roasted duck topped with a spicy basil sauce.  I was asked how spicy I wanted my dish.  On a scale of 1 to 10, I chose 7.  The server questioned whether I liked spicy foods and told me that they use fresh Thai spices.  I stuck with the 7.

After a reasonable amount of time, my dinner was brought and it smelled really good.  That matched the way it tasted too.  I would get a spice level of 8 another time but the 7 was good.

I was asked if I wanted chopsticks or silverware.  I opted for silverware because I don't eat Thai food with chopsticks.

Service was good.  I need to return to try some Vietnamese food they have and see how it stacks up against other Vietnamese palces.  There are also a number of duck dishes to get too.

The pho soup base is really good, no MSG, tastes fresh. The panang curry pork lunch special was not bad too, wished more rice comes with it but the pork was not as soft as expected. Definitely be back

This place is awesome!  It's 10x better then SideStreet Pho across the same Von's parking lot.  That place should stay as the name states "on the street side".  Lilly's is more authentic.  No reason for China mainlanders making Pho. Lilly's is the place togo!!

We ordered from here tonight for delivery, glad I did! 

We drove by the other day and saw they delivered, for us it is a game changer for my non cooking nights.

I found the menu online,  Thai we pretty much always order our favorites.  Our normals are this time Shrimp Pad Thai (we got a level 5 out of 10)  Panang Curry ( level 9 ) and  Papaya Salad ( level 7 )

The food was GREAT I loved it and almost reminded me of Thailand i am so happy to find a great place this side of town since our move to this side.  I will be ordering again!!! 

I do recommend thinking about your spice level.  This place does not lie, a level 10 might burn your face off.  I order from my spice level from past places and this place is true to word for hotness!   I loved it and will be my Go To Thai place...


Great Job!

Not bad. Kinda empty on account of them being new, I think. I've only had one dish. Drunken noodle(Pad Kee Mao). It's spicy :-) yummy. I got a seven in spiciness.  I like that it's not overly fishy.  Some Thai places use too much fish paste for my liking.  The lady who takes orders and mans the front shows little emotion but her words are nice.  I can't speak about the taste of the pho but it looked good.   Overall I'd say it's a good place to hold you over when you're hankering for some Thai or Vietnamese food. I like it because it's close to my house. 3.5 stars but rounded up.  Prices higher than Thai places near here
Always amazing! Favorites include Tom Kha Gai soup and Pad See Ew. Pho is also great! You can't go wrong with these choices. Melvin is the BEST!

Their seafood pho, summer rolls, veggie pho, and shrimp tempura were delicious!!! The server was very polite and recommended different dishes when my sister was indecisive about what to get. He listened and took what she said into consideration when giving suggestions. The place was a little small, but was clean and comfortable.

A mom-and-pop joint serving food made with love.
My wife and I have eaten here half a dozen times in as many months--just to see if this place would remain as good as we hoped it might.
Decision? Delicious. Again and again. And again. 
I blame the master cooks at Lilly's for the two pounds I gained these past six months. 
This place is in a nondescript strip mall, but as all longtime Las Vegans know, some of the best neighborhood joints are snugly nestled back in these smaller neighborhood shopping centers.
From the sizzling, juicy chicken satay (and god, do NOT miss either the rich, creamy peanut sauce or the crisp, refreshing mini salad that comes with this appetizer) to the pho to a variety of thai curry dishes to the stir-fry, Lilly's offers some of the absolute best Thai food (and Vietnamese, too!) in our part of the valley.
The delivery through Yelp is fast and accurate, and the dining-in experience at the restaurant is great, too. Mostly teens work here at night, but these kids are on their game. Great service, great attitude from the servers, very helpful . . . a great neighborhood spot.

Ordered the pho dac biet xe lua and was expecting a massive bowl. I should have read the menu and walked out after seeing that there was only 3 types of meat that came with it. And although broth was great, what came out was a kids bowl with hardly any meat in it. Seriously such a disappointment.  Service was okay. $9 wasted and I'm still hungry. That was basically an appetizer.

My stomach feels a little weird after eating it as well so there might be some MSG in the broth.
T'was pretty good.....there's another pho place on the same parking lot, which is a little wierd, but I think this place is slightly better, and a little cheaper.
Was decent, nothing special. I like that they are open late. Ordered Sticky mango rice and the rice was really really hard. Like undercooked. Maybe just a bad day for the chef.
I recently moved from Henderson and have needed to find my new go to Thai spot for drunken noodles, found it!

Tom Kha (sp?) soup was absolutely delicious. Love the option to make anything vegetarian. Drunken noodle was flavorful and not too spicy for the little ones (which is rare). BF got some cashew vegetarian and the sauce was flavorful and delicious. Thai tea was also great. Will most definitely be back for more.

Haven't even eaten our food yet!! However I placed an order for delivery about 1 1/2 hours ago and still no food. No call no text no email saying that they were busy or running late. Tried calling and they set the phone to the side and I held for 3 minutes. Called back and they said the driver was on his way but it's been 25 minutes since then! I don't know who's fault this is the restaurant or eatstreet but it's really upsetting! Guess who's not ordering from them again? Or using eatstreet!!
Great lunch specials.  Everyone who works there is super nice.  I love the curry.  Plenty of food for a lunch special, so you can take food home.  The service is very good.

We ordered 4 dishes to go and it came out to about $55. That's a lot for take out. But, if it's exceptional in taste or value, there's nothing to complain about. Well, it was average in both. It wasn't bad, just not great. 

Taste-wise, it was ok. Nothing was really off or funky. But, it wasn't the best Thai ever. Portion-wise, it was on the skimpy side. The square fliplid togo containers were the smaller size of the larger looking kind. And, they weren't really packed full.

I'll be trying different Thai places before I return to this one for another shot.

Loved this place.

Their spring rolls are YUM

I really enjoyed their tofu pad Thai. Very clean place, small and the service was excellent. Definitely returning.
Food was excellent. Lunch for two.  Pad see eew,  Pad Thai,  fried wontons and two beverages for $28. Great deal,  great food and super sweet staff.  Thank you Lillys Yhai & Vietnamese Cafe

First visit, i usually travel all the way to DownTown for Le Thai. I enjoyed the food, very tasty. I now do not have to travel so far for good Thai food! I am very picky & i was pleased. The server was very attentive.

I absolutely adore lilies and find myself eating their vegan, or veggie combination for PHO there at least 2 to 3 times every week! Wall every PHO I've had in Las Vegas has been good, very few places make it great. This place in fact does an incredible job and aunts just the right amount of anise, where I found many places either use an overabundance too little or none at all. Anyone who is either made or grown up with someone making fun knows that the perfect amount of Anise is crucial.
The only reason why I didn't give Lily is five out of five stars is because every single time I go there for dine in instead of take out The waiter rarely comes back to her table I believe in most circumstances they only came to our table to deliver the food while I understand that waiters and waitresses are busy and have many patrons take care of every single time I've been there I've been the only person who Is doing at the restaurant at the time. While the waiter is always exceedingly friendly and kind a little more attentiveness would be a big bonus however the lack of attention has never impacted I tip nor detracted from my experience however I think improving that attentiveness would definitely reflect a five star rating
Fresh spring rolls were awesome, ordered the double delight wish was full of flavor, pad thai was also great. The owners were super nice and gave great service. Will definitely be back!

My Gf and I decided to try this place since we normally go to Sidestreet pho nearby.  We both ordered Pho noodles and what you get here is stingy!  Compared to any pho place I have been to this place probably gives the least even for a regular portion bowl.  They didn't ask me for regular or large and wasn't on the menu.  They gave me seriously 3 slices of beef and the noodles weren't alot.  So that wasn't good. 

So anyways, as for taste, the soup stock was really bland and light.  Not inspiring or good in the taste department either.  From my understanding they are a thai restaurant more than a vietnamese so maybe ordering the pho wasn't a good idea.  Maybe I'll try the Thai food next time, but I can't give it higher than a 2 for the noodles.

I will be honest and say that I don't come here for the Vietnamese food. I come for the Thai food. It is my favorite place to come for Thai food. I love the pad se ew and it is not on the menu, but the yum woon sen (silver noodle salad) is literally the best one I have ever had. I come in a couple of times a month with my husband. I always order the same thing, the yum woon sen as an appetizer and the pad se ew with seafood. The squid tastes so fresh! My husband has tried quite a few different items on the menu. He has enjoyed every dish he has tried. The server is really nice and the food always comes out in a timely manner.

I have been meaning to write a review for this sweet little place and the lovely family that runs it.  I had been running around setting up new doctors and appointments after moving to Las Vegas from  California. Phones, tv, insurance, driver's license, etc. etc. 
My head was spinning. I was pooped and hungry and lower than a snake's belly. Was too tired to drop by Von's for a soggy sandwichDon't know why I decided to look around on the other side of their ten mile long (or so it seems) parking lot but I am so glad I did. I had never had POH before but the price was right. It was cold out and Martha Stewart had just been raving about this Vietnamese traditional soup she was making on her show so I said to myself, why not? Good enough for Martha should be good enough for me.  What a comforting and delicious soup.  I don't know how it is supposed to taste. All I know is the shrimp pho I had was just what the doctor ordered. (No pun intended) I was going to take it home to eat but had such a nice time visiting with the owner while waiting for my soup I ate it there. There was enough left over to have for a light lunch the next day and he graciously wrapped it up so it wouldn't spill. Tiny place, big on service and good food. Now that the weather has turned cool finally I am going to go over there and see what else might warm my heart and belly.

Come on now Nothing can't top this place for having the best Thai Food! I really love spicy drunken noodles and pad thai noodles here! This place is really cool! Very clean and employees is so sweet and price is right!

Ordered delivery took over an hour. Order was wrong. The summer rolls are absolutely terrible and they are something I normally enjoy. Also my pho came with brown wilted bean sprouts that smelled rotten. I will not be ordering again.

Nice job Lilly's.   Kidding.  Usually go to Side street Pho in the same parking lot.  Decided to try you.  Hours say open until 10.  9:40 I enter and you tell me closed.   That's ok.  I'm at Sidestreet Pho.

This place has some really good food, I highly recommend it! I got the tom ka gai and it was better than Le Thai which I thought was the best in town. I also tried the pork larb, yum! The food is fresh and delicious and priced right. Must try!

I am what they may call picky or high expectations , I am Thrilled with every single item that I got:
Summer rolls (cold fresh rice paper w shrimp and the flavors are great)
Tom ka gai soup (chicken was on point and I did 3 star spicy which still has heat to it)
Sticky rice w mango (I pop in fridge to get cold)

Worst pho ever. The portions were smaller than any other pho restaurant I have ever been to. It's cheaper than most places, but you get what you pay for. The quality of the meat and the amount of the meat were lacking. This place is uninspiring and lousy. I would rather go to any other place for pho. On a good note, the service was good. SIDE STREET CAFE ACROSS THE STREET IS 100000000 TIMES BETTER, AND THEIR PHO IS ONE OF THE BEST!

I'm sorry but I really didn't think the lunch I had, BUN THIT NUONG CHA GlO (charbroiled pork and eggrolls with vermicelli and vegetables) was nearly as good as I have had in several Vietnamese restaurants in Las Vegas. Maybe it's my fault as I didn't order a Thai dish but with so many Vietnamese dishes on the menu I thought it must be one of their specialties. The rice noodles were fine, prepared well, the fish sauce is fish sauce (I think they all buy the same one) but the charbroiled pork wasn't very good (thick chunks that were not tender or charbroiled looking) and the eggrolls were disappointing. If you like this dish got to Kim Long on Spring Mountain, it's wonderful. I may try Lilly's again but if I do I'll order something Thai.

Was getting my mails done next and decided to stop on by. So glad I did. 

They have a lovely dining area. Open floor plan. Average four ppl per table. 

Offer lunch specials, great variety too. Most locations limit what they offer. These lunch specials are great. 

The portion is a nice size. About half the plate and and egg roll. I nice size plate not a little one. Lol. 

Easy to find as well. Definitely want to come try the duck dishes. Smell so good.

We came on a Saturday night after 7 pm and were surprised the place was almost empty.

This surprised us because the spring rolls were the best we have had since leaving Chicago.  We used to live a block from a Vietnamese business district and were introduced to spring rolls there.

The green curry was hot and spicy enough with a 6 rating.  My wife also had a vermicelli noodle dish and it was delicious.

Service was personable and the restaurant was very clean.  Great job!
My husband and I stopped here for lunch today! The food and service was outstanding, the flavors incredible, we will definitely be back.
